remarks: The ` i ` -dimensional free module over a ring ` r ` is the product of ` i ` -many copies of the ring with componentwise addition and multiplication.  If ` i ` is infinite, the allowed vectors are restricted to those with finitely many nonzero coordinates; this ensures that the resulting module is actually spanned by its unit vectors. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)
